events.name: MSite Certificate Study Jam [KDU]
events.description:
MSite (Mobile Site) Study Jams is a professional accreditation that Google offers to individuals who demonstrate the understanding of basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development.

During this event, our Facilitators will guide and teach you the concepts. After the lessons, participants will take the FREE CERTIFICATION EXAM from Google. Participants that complete the exam will receive a printable Google certificate to verify status as a certified mobile sites professional.

- About Msite Certificate
The MSites certification is a professional accreditation that Google offers to individuals who demonstrate proficiency in basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development. A Mobile Sites certification allows individuals to demonstrate that Google recognizes them as an expert in mobile sites. You can earn the certification through Academy for Ads, Google's online training program.

**This is a private event for KDU arranged student only

events.name: Google IO Extended 2018
events.description:
Ticket Selling in Eventbrite https://ioxgt.eventbrite.com/?aff=social

Google I/O 2018 Extended brings out the best of technologies all the way from Silicon Valley to George Town, Penang. This year in Google IO had been announced exciting technologies and we GDG are happy to share the technologies that what has been happening in this year, we hope to see Google geeks and machine learner to-be shows up in this event and learn the latest technology for web and machine learning. We also have some special guest from Google DevRel Team! They will be announcing some exciting news with us! Grab your opportunity now and get a ticket for yourself to join this event!

Get your ticket for FREE now! Seats are limited so, be quick.

Google IO Extended Agenda

09:00 am - Breakfast & Registration
10:00 am - Opening Remarks
10:15 am - Learning Google Technologies - 30 min
11:45 am - Build Fast, Scalable, Modern App With PWA by Vin Lim - 1 Hrs
12:00 pm - Lunch
13:00 pm - Angular Love PWA by Jecelyn Yeen - 1 Hrs
13:00 am - Building cross platform apps with Flutter and Firebase by Lim Shang Yi - 2 Hrs
14:00 pm - The Modern Web: State of the Union By Henry Lim - 1 Hrs
Speaker Bio

Lim Shang Yi
Shang Yi loves what's interesting in technology. He mainly works with Java, Angular, HTML5, Typescript. During the weekends he occasionally codes on Ionic sometimes cluelessly tinkerers with Arduino . When he feels like he needs a change of scenery, he occasionally tries his hands on baking and cooking. He is has a quirky sense of humor and likes to indulge in creepypastas, and occasionally binge on DIY videos.

Henry Lim
Henry is a front-end web developer from Kuala Lumpur. He’s also a community co-organizer of Google Developer Group Kuala Lumpur.
He’s a big fan of Google’s cutting-edge technologies, including Polymer, Progressive Web Apps, and Firebase. He will stop at nothing to educate everyone around him about them.
While he’s not coding, he likes to play piano and listen to his favorite band - Mayday.

Jecelyn Yeen
Jecelyn specializes in professional application development with technologies, including Angular, HTML5, Typescript, JavaScript, CSS, C#, NodeJs and ASP.NET. Jecelyn has over 8 years of programming experience which includes working on ERP, shared services and fintech products, from enterprise to startup. She has held various roles from developer to consultant to team manager to her latest being software architect at a Fortune 500 MNC.
When Jecelyn isn’t busy distinguishing herself as (usually) the only female engineer on her team, she’s funnelling her passion in tech into publishing articles on Medium and Scotch.io as well as sharing her knowledge via workshops and conferences and meet-ups.
She is the current Director of Women Who Code Kuala Lumpur, a non-profit organization that connects and supports women to excel in the tech industry since 2014 through meet ups and codelabs.
Ironically her favourite past time away from work involves travelling to remote islands without WiFi for deep sea diving expeditions and reading books with tangible covers. Springing a rubber spider on her lap is a very effective method of striking terror in her heart.

Vin Lim
Vin is the Co-Founder and CEO of Green Room, a leading mobile and web application development company, with a portfolio of major international and local brands. Together with his team, he specialises in cross-platform application development, with technologies like TypeScript, Angular and various modern web technologies.
His journey in the tech and startup scene has sparked his enthusiasm in building tech community, leading to the founding of Startup Penang, GDG George Town and Angular Malaysia. To contribute to the ecosystem further, he has been speaking in various local and international tech conferences, promoting web technologies.
When he is not working, you will find him tinkering and building stuff, from applications to hardwares.

events.name: DevFest & BizFest GeorgeTown 2018

venue.name: TARC TUNKU ABDUL RAHMAN UNIVERSITY COLLEGE

events.description:
DevFest & BizFest George Town is back for the 5th year!

Come join in the fun with hundreds of tech enthusiasts and business professionals in our annual most epic dev and biz conference up north.

In this one day conference, we cover six tracks filled with over 25 talks and workshops by speakers from local and abroad.

4 tracks of technical talks and workshops
1 track for Womenwill programs
1 business and tech-related track
This event is a platform for you to learn new things about open source technology, and effective business with technology in this ever-changing world.

WHO IS THIS EVENT FOR
- Entrepreneurs
- Business Professional
- Developers
- Students
- Anyone who's interested in open-source technology, marketing, and advertising, business and networking

Stay tune ticket will be available soon!
** note that the ticket purchase here will not be valid for the event please purchase a ticket with this link https://goo.gl/fCPWpa

events.name: Data, ML, AI Study Jam (Bring your own laptop)
events.description:
For Purchase the ticket please go to this link:
https://study-cloud-data-gdggeorgetown.peatix.com/view

Big data, machine learning, and artificial intelligence are today’s hot computing topics, but these fields are quite specialized and introductory material is hard to come by. Fortunately, GCP provides user-friendly services in these areas, with this study jam you will require to go through a workshop, with complete the workshop you will have an understanding with how to use GCP with tools like Big Query, Cloud Speech API, and Cloud ML Engine.

To celebrate International Women Day, all women who wish to join the study jam will be eligible to apply for a complimentary ticket by using this promo code: InternationalWomenDay

Agenda
- 9:30 - Registration
- 10:00 - A brief introduction the study jam
- 10:20 - Start study jam!
- 12:00 - Lunch & Networking
- 13:00 - Continue the study jam!
- 16:30 - Wrap up and networking

THINGS TO TAKE NOTE:
1. BRING YOUR OWN LAPTOP. This study jam will be conducted through your web browser. Tablets are NOT RECOMMENDED. No additional software required.

2. Sometimes there are video introductions which we RECOMMEND to bring earphones/headset.

3. In this study jam, we will be focusing on this course: https://www.qwiklabs.com/quests/34. Take a look and see what to expect to learn about. Free Credits to start this course will be given to you on the day.
events.how_to_find_us: Go to the 3rd floor and look for the room labeled Training Room. you will find us all there warm welcoming ~
